title: Light-mode solid white surfaces for Demo role switcher dropdown and Training Visit form

requirements.summary: Ensure the Demo/Preview Mode role switcher trigger and dropdown content render with solid white backgrounds in light mode while preserving existing dark-mode styling and behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: When Demo/Preview Mode is active, the role switcher SelectTrigger in the top banner renders with a solid white background in light mode.
When the role switcher dropdown is opened, the dropdown content surface renders with a solid white background in light mode (no transparency).
In dark mode, the role switcher retains the existing dark-mode look and remains readable (do not force a white background in dark mode).
No changes to role-switching behavior: selecting a role still updates the demo role and navigates to the correct dashboard route.

file_operations.description: Update the role switcher SelectTrigger and SelectContent className styling to force a solid white surface in light mode (e.g., bg-white and non-transparent overrides), while explicitly preserving the existing dark-mode surface tokens via dark: classes. Keep all role-switching logic unchanged and avoid touching any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

requirements.summary: Ensure the Training Visit create/edit dialogâ€™s form container renders with a solid white background in light mode while preserving existing dark-mode styling and functionality.
acceptanceCriteria: On the Training Visits page, opening the Log Visit dialog shows the entire form container with a solid white background in light mode (no transparency).
On the Training Visits page, opening the Edit Training Visit dialog shows the entire form container with a solid white background in light mode (no transparency).
In dark mode, the dialog keeps the existing dark-mode background tokens and remains readable (do not force a white background in dark mode).
Opening and closing the dialog, saving, and canceling do not produce runtime errors and do not break Demo/Preview Mode behavior.

file_operations.description: Adjust the Create/Edit Visit DialogContent styling so the entire visit form container uses a solid white background in light mode (e.g., bg-white) and preserves existing dark-mode styling via dark: classes (keep current tokens/behavior for dark mode). Scope changes only to the training visit dialog (not global styles) and do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui.
